recipe.title: Tiramisu
recipe.description: Classic Italian dessert with coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone

steps.descr: Whisk egg yolks with sugar until pale and thick
steps.instructions: Whisk egg yolks with sugar until pale and thick

on_enter.say: Right, let's whisk those egg yolks with the sugar until they're lovely and pale and thick. You'll see it become a creamy delight!
Now, let's beat in that mascarpone until it's smooth as silk. This is going to be the creamy heart of our tiramisu!

steps.descr: Whip egg whites to stiff peaks, fold into mascarpone
steps.instructions: Whip egg whites to stiff peaks, fold into mascarpone

on_enter.say: Let's whip those egg whites until they form stiff peaks. You'll know they're ready when they hold their shape beautifully. Then, gently fold them into the mascarpone mixture.
Now, let's mix that strong espresso with a splash of Marsala. This will give our tiramisu that classic Italian kick!

steps.descr: Dip ladyfingers briefly in coffee, layer in dish
steps.instructions: Dip ladyfingers briefly in coffee, layer in dish

on_enter.say: Right, let's dip those ladyfingers briefly in our coffee mixture and layer them in the dish. Just a quick dip, we don't want them too soggy!

steps.descr: Spread half the mascarpone cream, repeat layers
steps.instructions: Spread half the mascarpone cream, repeat layers

on_enter.say: Let's spread half of that luscious mascarpone cream over the ladyfingers, and then repeat the layers. This is where it all comes together!

steps.descr: Refrigerate 4 hours, dust with cocoa before serving
steps.instructions: Refrigerate 4 hours, dust with cocoa before serving

on_enter.say: Fantastic! Now, let's pop it in the fridge for four hours to set. Before serving, give it a lovely dusting of cocoa powder. Your tiramisu will be a masterpiece!

notes.text:
Don't oversoak the biscuits
Use good quality espresso
Best made a day ahead
